question_1.question: What is the primary purpose of using perspectives in a data warehouse?

options.option_a: To increase the processing speed of the data warehouse
options.option_b: To make it easier to work with instances that contain a lot of objects
options.option_c: To reduce the amount of storage used by the data warehouse
options.option_d: To enhance the security of the data warehouse

question_1.explanation: Perspectives are used to simplify working with instances that have many objects, by providing a subset of objects related to a specific area, thus improving overview and accessibility.

question_2.question: What happens when you activate a dynamic perspective in a data warehouse?

options.option_a: It deletes objects that are not part of the perspective
options.option_b: It hides objects that are not part of the perspective
options.option_c: It archives objects that are not part of the perspective
options.option_d: It duplicates objects that are part of the perspective

question_2.explanation: Activating a dynamic perspective hides all objects outside the subset of related objects, making it easier to focus on a specific area.

question_3.question: How are objects implicitly included in a dynamic perspective indicated?
question_3.explanation: In dynamic perspectives, implicitly included objects are marked by a dot, while explicitly included objects are noted by a checkmark.

question_4.question: Which of the following is a way to deploy and/or execute a perspective?

options.option_a: By emailing the perspective to the data warehouse admin
options.option_b: By printing and manually executing the perspective
options.option_c: In the Solution Explorer, right-click the perspective and select Deploy, Execute, or Deploy and Execute
options.option_d: By adding the perspective to a social media post

question_4.explanation: Perspectives can be deployed and/or executed by right-clicking them in the Solution Explorer and selecting the appropriate option.
